issue.title: Hash support for pmr::string and friends

discussion.p: In most cases, std::pmr::meow is a drop-in replacement for std::meow. The exception is std::pmr::{,w,u16,u32}string, because unlike their std:: counterparts, they don't come with enabled std::hash specializations.

The P/R below simply adds std::hash specializations for those four typedefs. An alternative approach, for which wording can be produced if desired, is to make the hash specializations for basic_string allocator-agnostic, similar to the partial specialization of hash for vector<bool>.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4659.

blockquote.p: -1- If S is one of these string types, SV is the corresponding string view type, and s is an object of type S, then hash<S>()(s) == hash<SV>()(SV(s)).
